definition: A preposition or adverb that indicates a temporal or spatial limit, often used to express a point in time or a location that marks the end of a range or extent. It is commonly used to denote "until" or "up to" in various contexts, such as indicating a time frame, a destination, or a limit in quantity.

examples.german: Er arbeitet von Montag bis Freitag.
examples.english: He works from Monday to Friday.

examples.german: Wir haben bis sp√§t in die Nacht gefeiert.
examples.english: We partied until late at night.

examples.german: Sie hat bis zum Ende durchgehalten.
Ich warte hier bis du kommst.
examples.english: I'll wait here until you come.
